title: Exomod Concepts 2022 Dodge Challenger SRT Hellcat Redeye D69 Carbon Daytona
description: This 2022 Dodge Challenger SRT Hellcat Redeye was modified by Exomod Concepts of Greenville, Pennsylvania, with a 1969 Dodge Charger Daytona–style carbon-fiber body, and it has 313 miles. Finished in Firenze Red Pearl with exposed-carbon-fiber accents, the car features a tapered nose panel with tinted headlight covers in addition to an elevated rear wing, hood, and fender scoops, and sequential LED taillights. A supercharged 6.2-liter Hemi V8 is linked to an eight-speed automatic transmission and a limited-slip differential, and equipment includes Forgeline DE3C 20” wheels, Brembo brake calipers, adaptive dampers, and traction control. Inside, two-tone leather upholstery is joined by heated and ventilated front seats, dual-zone automatic climate control, a Harman Kardon sound system, and UConnect infotainment with navigation and a backup camera. After the car was completed in 2023, it was featured in several magazines, including Road & Track, and received the Super Street/Modified Blue Ribbon Award at the Muscle Car and Corvette Nationals. This modified Challenger is now offered with awards and a clean Idaho title.
author: bringatrailer
excerpt: Bid for the chance to own a Exomod Concepts 2022 Dodge Challenger SRT Hellcat Redeye D69 Carbon Daytona at auction with Bring a Trailer, the home of the best vintage and classic cars online. Lot #202,518.
text: This 2022 Dodge Challenger SRT Hellcat Redeye was modified by Exomod Concepts of Greenville, Pennsylvania, with a 1969 Dodge Charger Daytona–style carbon-fiber body, and it has 313 miles. Finished in Firenze Red Pearl with exposed-carbon-fiber accents, the car features a tapered nose panel with tinted headlight covers in addition to an elevated rear wing, hood, and fender scoops, and sequential LED taillights. A supercharged 6.2-liter Hemi V8 is linked to an eight-speed automatic transmission and a limited-slip differential, and equipment includes Forgeline DE3C 20” wheels, Brembo brake calipers, adaptive dampers, and traction control. Inside, two-tone leather upholstery is joined by heated and ventilated front seats, dual-zone automatic climate control, a Harman Kardon sound system, and UConnect infotainment with navigation and a backup camera. After the car was completed in 2023, it was featured in several magazines, including Road & Track, and received the Super Street/Modified Blue Ribbon Award at the Muscle Car and Corvette Nationals. This modified Challenger is now offered with awards and a clean Idaho title. Exomod Concepts modified this Challenger SRT Hellcat Redeye with molded-carbon-fiber bodywork inspired by the 1969 Charger Daytona. Rebadged as a D69 Carbon Daytona, the car is finished in Firenze Red Pearl with exposed carbon-fiber accenting the hood scoop, lip spoiler, rear wing, diffuser, and sills. The tapered nose panel has a narrow mesh grille and tinted headlight covers. Sequential LED taillights have been added, and other details include fender scoops, a polished fuel filler, and central exhaust outlets. Forgeline DE3C 20” wheels have bronze-finished centers and are wrapped in Nitto NT555 tires. The car is equipped with a Competition suspension with adaptive dampers, traction control, stability control, and electronic roll mitigation. Braking is handled by red-finished Brembo calipers with six-piston units up front. The cabin features heated and ventilated front bucket seats and a contoured rear bench trimmed in Katzkin-branded Ink leather with Walnut accents that carry over to the door panel inserts. Additional appointments include a power-adjustable driver’s seat, dual-zone automatic climate control, remote start, a backup camera, ParkSense rear park assist, an 18-speaker Harman Kardon sound system with a trunk-mounted subwoofer, and UConnect infotainment with navigation. The leather-wrapped steering wheel frames a red 220-mph speedometer and 7k-rpm tachometer on either side of a configurable digital display. The digital odometer indicates 313 miles The supercharged 6.2-liter Hemi V8 features a forged crankshaft, connecting rods, and pistons in addition to an SRT Power Chiller, which works in conjunction with the air conditioning system to lower intake air temperature. Factory output was rated at 797 horsepower and 707 lb-ft of torque. Power is sent to the rear wheels through a TorqueFlite HP90 eight-speed automatic transmission and a limited-slip differential with 3.09:1 gearing. The car received the Super Street/Modified Blue Ribbon Award at the 2024 Muscle Car and Corvette Nationals, scoring 998 out of 1,000 possible points. The Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage and lists at least one open recall. You are not connected to real-time updates. Attempting to connect. html:
This 2022 Dodge Challenger SRT Hellcat Redeye was modified by Exomod Concepts of Greenville, Pennsylvania, with a 1969 Dodge Charger Daytona–style carbon-fiber body, and it has 313 miles. Finished in Firenze Red Pearl with exposed-carbon-fiber accents, the car features a tapered nose panel with tinted headlight covers in addition to an elevated rear wing, hood, and fender scoops, and sequential LED taillights. A supercharged 6.2-liter Hemi V8 is linked to an eight-speed automatic transmission and a limited-slip differential, and equipment includes Forgeline DE3C 20” wheels, Brembo brake calipers, adaptive dampers, and traction control. Inside, two-tone leather upholstery is joined by heated and ventilated front seats, dual-zone automatic climate control, a Harman Kardon sound system, and UConnect infotainment with navigation and a backup camera. After the car was completed in 2023, it was featured in several magazines, including Road & Track, and received the Super Street/Modified Blue Ribbon Award at the Muscle Car and Corvette Nationals. This modified Challenger is now offered with awards and a clean Idaho title.

Exomod Concepts modified this Challenger SRT Hellcat Redeye with molded-carbon-fiber bodywork inspired by the 1969 Charger Daytona. Rebadged as a D69 Carbon Daytona, the car is finished in Firenze Red Pearl with exposed carbon-fiber accenting the hood scoop, lip spoiler, rear wing, diffuser, and sills.

The tapered nose panel has a narrow mesh grille and tinted headlight covers.

Sequential LED taillights have been added, and other details include fender scoops, a polished fuel filler, and central exhaust outlets.

Forgeline DE3C 20” wheels have bronze-finished centers and are wrapped in Nitto NT555 tires. The car is equipped with a Competition suspension with adaptive dampers, traction control, stability control, and electronic roll mitigation. Braking is handled by red-finished Brembo calipers with six-piston units up front.

The cabin features heated and ventilated front bucket seats and a contoured rear bench trimmed in Katzkin-branded Ink leather with Walnut accents that carry over to the door panel inserts. Additional appointments include a power-adjustable driver’s seat, dual-zone automatic climate control, remote start, a backup camera, ParkSense rear park assist, an 18-speaker Harman Kardon sound system with a trunk-mounted subwoofer, and UConnect infotainment with navigation.

The leather-wrapped steering wheel frames a red 220-mph speedometer and 7k-rpm tachometer on either side of a configurable digital display. The digital odometer indicates 313 miles

The supercharged 6.2-liter Hemi V8 features a forged crankshaft, connecting rods, and pistons in addition to an SRT Power Chiller, which works in conjunction with the air conditioning system to lower intake air temperature. Factory output was rated at 797 horsepower and 707 lb-ft of torque.

Power is sent to the rear wheels through a TorqueFlite HP90 eight-speed automatic transmission and a limited-slip differential with 3.09:1 gearing.

The car received the Super Street/Modified Blue Ribbon Award at the 2024 Muscle Car and Corvette Nationals, scoring 998 out of 1,000 possible points.

The Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage and lists at least one open recall.
